card.title: Decrypt and Encrypt Text
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript
card.description: This was my first solo project, where I created a tool for exchanging secret messages using simple encryption keys. It aimed to apply skills learned from the Alura Front-end Bootcamp in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and agile tools like Trello and Figma. The tool transforms original text into a different format based on encryption keys. It includes a feature to copy encrypted or decrypted text to the clipboard with ease.

card.title: Responsive Travel Website with Background Video Slider
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript
card.description: In this project, I learned how to craft a visually appealing web design using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The website features a background video slider with navigation buttons that enable seamless exploration of each slide, enhanced by the magic of JavaScript. Smooth transitions between slides were achieved using the clip-path property.

card.title: User Card with Light & Dark Mode Toggle
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript
card.description: In my "User Card with Light & Dark Mode Toggle" project, I aimed to practice CSS Flexbox and CSS variables. This project features a user card component where you can see the user's name, role, and social media links. The best part? You can easily switch between light and dark modes with a simple toggle, making it both visually appealing and user-friendly. It's a straightforward demonstration of how HTML, CSS, and JavaScript can come together to create an interactive and dynamic user interface.

card.title: TODO App
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript
card.description: A simple TODO application to help you manage your daily tasks efficiently. You can quickly add new tasks, mark them as completed, and remove them once you're done. This project was part of the Oracle - Alura Latam bootcamp, where one of the main goals was to practice DOM manipulation. Through this project, I improved my JavaScript skills, especially in manipulating the DOM to create dynamic and interactive user interfaces.

card.title: Testimonial App Clone
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React
card.description: This project is a clone of a testimonial app that displays feedback from freeCodeCamp alumni. It was created as part of the freeCodeCamp React course. The Testimonial Component is a reusable React component designed to showcase each testimonial. Testimonials are statically hardcoded into the component for simplicity. This project marks my initial steps into the world of React development, where I gained hands-on experience in building reusable components and managing state within a React application.

card.title: Click Counter
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React
card.description: This project is a simple click counter app developed to learn and demonstrate the use of useState in React. It allows users to increment a counter with each click and reset it to zero. The key features include the ability to increment the counter by clicking a button and reset it using another button. This project was part of the freeCodeCamp React course, where I gained practical experience with React's useState hook.

card.title: Interactive Calculator
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Math.js
card.description: This project demonstrates how to create a functional calculator using React, incorporating components, state management, and Math.js for mathematical calculations. The goal is to solidify understanding of React concepts while building a practical and interactive tool, enabling users to perform basic arithmetic operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. The app also features a dedicated clear button to reset the current input.

card.title: TODO List
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React
card.description: This project is a simple To-Do List app that I developed to get better at using React. With this app, you can easily add new tasks, mark them as complete, and remove them once theyâ€™re done. I used react-icons to make the task icons look great and the uuid library to give each task a unique ID. Working on this project was a fantastic way to learn more about React and build something useful for everyday life.

card.title: Sign In & Sign Up Form
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite
card.description: This project features a Sign In & Sign Up form created with ReactJS. Its primary focus is to practice and apply functional components in React, along with managing props and functions effectively. The project setup utilizes Vite for React. Key features include an interactive Sign In & Sign Up form and seamless switching between 'Sign In' and 'Sign Up' functionalities using React components. Bootstrap Icons are incorporated to enhance visual appeal.

card.title: Org - Team Management
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Figma
card.description: Org is a user-friendly platform that helps you manage and organize your team efficiently. Easily add new members with basic info like name, position, and photo. Create custom teams with unique colors for quick identification and highlight favorite team members for quick access and special recognition. This project is part of the Alura - Oracle React course, with resources from Figma and features react-icons and uuid.

card.title: Petshop CRUD Project
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / API / JSON Server
card.description: This project is a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) application designed for managing client profiles in a pet shop. The primary goal was to learn how to perform CRUD operations, interact with a RESTful API using fetch, and handle asynchronous tasks efficiently with async/await and try-catch blocks. The app allows you to create, read, update, and delete client profiles seamlessly while keeping the code clean and manageable.

card.title: Pet News Blog
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Axios / React Router / JSON Server
card.description: This project is a Pet News Blog, part of the React course at Alura Latam. It features a variety of pet-related news articles with easy navigation through different categories and subcategories. If you land on a non-existent route, you'll see a custom 404 page. The app uses axios for fetching data, react-router-dom for seamless navigation, and json-server to create a mock REST API. Working on this project helped me get comfortable with useState and useEffect hooks, React Router, and building a Single Page Application (SPA).

card.title: Smart Bank
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Styled-Components
card.description: The Smart Bank app let you do a variety of things like checking your account balance, viewing recent expenses, and switching between light and dark themes. The app uses Styled-Components to make styling React components modular and reusable. The main goal of this project was to get hands-on practice with Styled-Components, while also improving  my skills in React and JavaScript.

card.title: Delivery Food Form Validation with JavaScript
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Styled-Components / Material UI
card.description: Delivery Food Form Validation with JavaScript showcases how to implement form validation in a React application using pure JavaScript. This project was developed to practice state management with useState and enhance form validation skills. It features custom JavaScript functions for form validation, state management with useState, and a multi-step form with validation at each step.

card.title: React Form Validation with React Hook Form
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Styled-Components / React Hook Form / Material UI
card.description: React Form Validation demonstrates how to implement form validation using React Hook Form, styled-components for custom styling, and Material-UI for UI components. It showcases effective form validation techniques through React Hook Form, styled-components, and Material-UI for responsive design. This project allowed me to practice React, JavaScript, and styled-components, focusing on learning efficient form validation methods with React Hook Form.

card.title: MoviesHub
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Styled-Components / React Hook Form / Axios / React Router Dom / JSON Server / Trello
card.description: MoviesHub is a responsive web application developed as a challenge during the React course at Alura Latam. The project allows users to manage movies and categories by adding, editing, and deleting entries, all presented in an interactive and visually appealing interface. The application's design and implementation followed steps outlined in Trello. Key features include synchronized sliders for movies and categories, forms for creating new entries, and dynamic fetching of data from a JSON server. Technologies used include react-hook-form for form handling and react-slick for creating carousel/slider components in React, alongside the use of uuid.

card.title: Task List App
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / TypeScript
card.description: Task List App is a straightforward web application developed as a first-time project using TypeScript. It enables users to manage tasks by adding new ones and deleting them from the list. This project aims to introduce the developer to TypeScript's syntax, type annotations, and overall usage within a React application.

card.title: Social Media Dashboard with Theme Switcher
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Vite / Tailwind CSS
card.description: This project is a social media dashboard where users can track their followers and subscribers across platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube. The dashboard includes a theme switcher for toggling between light and dark themes to enhance user experience. The design is responsive, ensuring optimal viewing on different devices. Data for the dashboard is sourced from a JSON file and was part of the Frontend Mentor challenge. The primary goal was to familiarize myself for the first time with Tailwind CSS and to learn its implementation.

card.title: Advice Generator App
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Tailwind CSS / API / Vite
card.description: This Advice Generator app, developed as part of a Frontend Mentor challenge, fetches and displays random pieces of advice from the Advice Slip JSON API. Users can easily obtain new advice with a button click. The app features a user-friendly interface and is designed to be fully responsive. The primary objective of this project was to enhance skills in using Tailwind CSS and in consuming APIs.

card.title: News Website
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Tailwind CSS / React Icons / Vite
card.description: This project is a responsive news website that features a prominent section for main articles highlighting important news, a dynamic news container displaying the latest articles, and a section for popular articles. The creation of this website aimed to enhance my skills in Tailwind CSS, which I was beginning to learn. It was developed as part of the Frontend Mentor challenge.

card.title: Sunnyside Agency Landing Page
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Tailwind CSS / React Icons / Vite
card.description: This project is a responsive landing page for Sunnyside Agency, crafted as part of the Frontend Mentor challenge. It includes a complete header with navigation, an engaging homepage, detailed service descriptions, customer testimonials, a dynamic gallery showcasing their work, and a footer with additional links and social media integration. The landing page is designed to provide both visually appealing design and informative content across different devices.

card.title: Food Delivery App
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Tailwind CSS / React Icons / Vite
card.description: The Food Delivery App is a web application that lets users explore a wide variety of food options, check out detailed information about each item, add them to their cart, and proceed to checkout. Users can easily browse through different food categories, manage their cart by adding or removing items, and see the total amount due. The app is designed to provide a seamless and responsive experience on all devices.

card.title: Portfolio
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / Tailwind CSS / React Icons / Vite / API / Axios / Styled-Components / Material UI
card.description: This portfolio showcases my web development projects and skills. It features a modern, responsive design with smooth animations, a home page with an introduction, an about page, a projects page with live demo links, and a contact page with a form. It also includes a dark mode toggle for user preference.

card.title: E-commerce FashionHub
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / TypeScript / React / Tailwind CSS / React Hook Form / Material UI / Vite / Firestore
card.description: I developed a simple e-commerce platform to practice building online stores. Using Firebase for the first time, I focused on data storage and retrieval, including handling product listings, user interactions, and order management. This project was a great opportunity to learn Firebase and improve my skills in integrating real-time databases into my projects.

card.title: Memories Album App
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / TypeScript / React / Tailwind CSS / Firestore / API / Axios / React Router / React Hook Form / Material UI / Figma / Vite
card.description: The Memories Album App is built with React and TypeScript, allowing users to organize and display photo albums, filter images by categories, and add new photos through a form. The deployed version uses Firestore for data management, while the local development branch uses JSON Server. The app's design is inspired by a Figma project, where I used the developer mode to guide the implementation.

card.title: Travel Camp Landing Page
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / TypeScript / React / Tailwind CSS / Next.js / Jest / Testing Library
card.description: The Travel Camp Landing Page is a sample app for camping and nature lovers, showcasing a responsive design built with Next.js. This project helped me practice Jest and Testing Library for testing while exploring Tailwind CSS for modern styling. The landing page is fully responsive and uses reusable components for better maintainability.

card.title: Personal Budget Assistant
card.tech: React / Material-UI / Recharts / Nanostores / Axios / API
card.description: The Personal Budget Assistant is a user-friendly app designed to help individuals track their expenses, manage budgets, and visualize financial health through interactive charts. Built during the Nuwe & CaixaBank Tech Hackathon, this project challenged me to implement responsive and reusable components while focusing on delivering a seamless user experience. It was an incredible learning journey with modern tools like Recharts.

card.title: Digital Prescription
card.tech: HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / React / TypeScript / Next.js / Tailwind CSS / shadcn/ui / Material-UI / Zod / React Hook Form / JSON Server / Axios
card.description: Digital Prescription is a web application designed to streamline the management of medical prescriptions. It features dynamic dashboards for doctors, pharmacists, and patients, enabling easy creation, search, and management of prescriptions. The project was initiated during the ContCode hackathon and continued independently, adding additional features such as customizable lists.
